Is this related to her taking out the tube that was draining so much and leaving the one that was hardly draining anymore in? Of course the PS said not to worry.  I wanted to cry right there.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 02:31PM Colodisneylover wrote: Hi All- My first post on these boards....I just had a mastectomy (I have no idea what many abbreviations are on this board, still need to learn those) on Friday 2/4.  I got home on Saturday afternoon.  Had 16 lymph nodes removed after all previous tests said there was no involvement.  Very upsetting.  I am going to the plastic surgeon on Thursday to hopefully get a drain or two removed and meeting with the surgeon on Friday to discuss the pathology report.  I meet with my oncologist to discuss my treatment plan a week from Friday.  It feels like it's going to take forever to get here.  It looks like there are a few of us who had surgery very close to each other. I hope you are doing well. I am still in pain from the expanders and my arm feels like it's on fire from the lymph node removal.  Sleeping in a recliner was a great recommendation and Tylenol PM was the best thing ever since I haven't slept in weeks.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 09:38AM Colodisneylover wrote: I still have one drain in.  It is hopefully coming out Monday when I see the PS again, but I am quickly learning not to assume things will happen like I want them to.
